'''Jerald Wayne Mills''' (August 17, 1969 – November 23, 2013) was an American [[country music]]ian, known for touring with the '''Wayne Mills Band''' for over fifteen years and playing alongside [[Blake Shelton]], [[Jamey Johnson]] and 2006 ''[[American Idol]]'' winner [[Taylor Hicks]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Jerald Wayne Mills buried today|url=http://communities.washingtontimes.com/neighborhood/entertainment-news-and-reviews/2013/dec/8/jerald-wayne-mills-buried-today-live-stream-nashvi/|publisher=The Washington Times Communities|access-date=December 10, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Spike TV Apologizes for Airing 'Bar Rescue' Featuring Location of Wayne Mills Shooting|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/spike-tv-apologizes-airing-bar-659861|publisher=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=November 27, 2013|first=Ashley|last=Lee|date=November 25, 2013}}</ref> During his career, Mills released five studio albums (with a sixth unreleased) and two live albums. He had seven Top 20 singles in Europe from 2008 to 2010, including a chart-topper in Belgium in 2009.<ref name="gactv">{{cite web|title=Wayne Mills Band|url=http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_artists_a-z/article/0,,gac_26071_6036940,00.html|publisher=Great American Country|access-date=December 10, 2013}}</ref>

Mills played baseball for Wallace State Junior College and football for the [[University of Alabama]], earning a bachelor of science degree in education.<ref name="gactv" />

In the early hours of November 23, 2013, in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], Mills was shot in the head by bar owner Chris Ferrell, allegedly over an argument involving Mills lighting up a cigarette in a nonsmoking area. He was rushed to a hospital but later died.<ref>{{cite web|title=Wayne Mills: Country Singer Shot Dead|url=http://news.sky.com/story/1173434/wayne-mills-country-singer-shot-dead|publisher=Sky News|access-date=November 27, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Country singer shot dead in Nashville bar after owner catches him smoking|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/country-singer-shot-dead-nashville-bar-article-1.1528106|work=New York Daily News|access-date=November 27, 2013}}</ref> The incident occurred towards the end of an afterparty at the bar following a recent makeover it received for the television show ''[[Bar Rescue]]'', with its episode scheduled to air the following day. The episode featuring it was later pulled, and the bar closed shortly after.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hudak |first=Joseph |date=2015-03-09 |title=Bar Owner Found Guilty in Country Singer's Murder |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/bar-owner-found-guilty-in-murder-of-country-singer-wayne-mills-111973/ |access-date=2024-05-24 |website=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref> The building was demolished in 2016. On March 6, 2015, Ferrell was found guilty of [[second-degree murder]] in Mills' death and received a twenty-year sentence with no possibility of parole.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wkrn.com/2015/03/06/closing-arguments-underway-in-wayne-mills-murder-trial/|title=Jury finds bar owner guilty of second degree murder in Wayne Mills' death|work=WKRN.com}}</ref> The verdict and sentence were appealed<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/chris-ferrell-sentenced-wayne-mills-murder/|title=Man Sentenced for Murder of Singer Wayne Mills|first=Billy|last=Dukes|website=Taste of Country|date=April 28, 2015 }}</ref> but were upheld by the appeals court in 2019.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.cullmantribune.com/2019/08/19/friends-ride-to-remember-wayne-mills-2/ |title=Friends Ride to Remember Wayne Mills |first=Christy |last=Perry |date=August 19, 2019 |newspaper=The Cullman Tribune |access-date=September 15, 2022}}</ref> Mills left behind wife Carol, whom he had married in 2000,<ref>{{cite web|title=Obituaries|date=December 11, 2013 |url=http://www.thearabtribune.com/articles/2013/12/11/obituaries/obits6.txt|publisher=The Arab Tribune|access-date=December 17, 2013}}</ref> seven-year-old son Jack, and six-year-old niece Cali.

==In popular culture==

Mills is the subject of the song "King of Alabama" by [[Brent Cobb]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2018/03/brent_cobb_wayne_mills.html |title=New song honors murdered Alabama country singer Wayne Mills |website=al.com |date=March 9, 2018 |access-date=March 9, 2018}}</ref>
